Follow-up involves frequent clinical assessments, laboratory monitoring, and ongoing communication to adapt the treatment plan as needed, while engaging the patient and family to ensure understanding and adherence. This strategy balances urgent stabilization with comprehensive disease management, aligning with current guidelines and evidence-based practices to improve prognosis and quality of life.
